text:
Apple is reportedly losing $1 billion annually on Apple TV+

Are you subscribed to Apple TV+?

Source: @theinformation

The losses seem manageable for Apple. 

Their overall 2024 profits reached nearly $94 billion. 

TV+ represents their commitment to premium content. 

They're playing the long game here.
imo, apple has the best tv shows and movies of all streaming services.  they are just incredibly horrible at marketing.

Yes.

Ted Lasso, Severance, Silo, Shrinking, Hijack and Slow Horses are all good shows. 

However, most of these are one season and done so hard to justify returning to it daily
Yes. There is no second best
im not
Bullish
I will stop subscribing after the free trial.
Yes, I have Apple TV+. The content is top-notch, and I appreciate the focus on well-made productions rather than just churning out endless content.
Apple is playing the long game. They will turn a profit sooner or later.
Because they only care about getting A list celebrities. They literally don’t care about anything else

Yes I am a subscriber, it's an expected loss for all streaming services when they first get going.

Apple also (up until last year) was spending ridiculous amounts of money on production and content.

Lucky Apple can afford the lost, I believe they expect to lose 15-20 billion,
Great news, hopefully they will cancel the service soon
They will recover it with the latest Severance episode tomorrow
Too expensive… for the little content they offer

Siri is literally a program from 90”.
